Roll out of bed and into feudal Japan every Saturday morning with 
IFC's Sa=
murai Saturdays. Each week we present a classic samurai film 
from the mast=
ers of Japanese cinema. 

SWORD OF DOOM
Ryunosuke Tsukue (Tatsuya Nakadai) =
is a bloodthirsty, amoral young 
fighter who has no qualms about murdering =
the guilty or innocent. He 
kills a man in an exhibition match at his fenci=
ng school and is 
pursued by the slain warrior's brother. 
Saturday, Septem=
ber 18 at 8am ET


SAMURAI REBELLION
Toshiro Mifune plays Isaburo, a samura=
i whose loyalty to the feudal 
system falters when his lord demands that Is=
aburo's son Yogoro give 
up his bride, a woman who had originally been the =
lord's mistress.
Saturday, September 25, at 8am ET


MIYAMOTO MUSASHI
The f=
irst of director Hiroshi Inagaki=81fs Samurai trilogy gives us 
the origins=
 of legendary swordsman Musashi Miyamoto (Toshiro 
Mifune). A hotheaded orp=
han falsely accused of a crime, Miyamoto is 
rescued by a monk who sets him=
 on the path of the samurai.
Saturday, October 2, at 8am ET


DUEL AT ICHJO=
JI TEMPLE
Now a famous fighter, Miyamoto returns to Kyoto to challenge the =

leader of the eminent swordfighting school and further his 
reputation. Bu=
t while his skills with a sword have progressed, 
Miyamoto's character is f=
ar less admirable.
Saturday, October 9, at 8am ET 


GANRYU
Miyamoto gives =
up fighting to live as a humble farmer in the 
outskirts of a small village=
. But the life of a samurai isn=81ft easy 
to leave behind, and after savin=
g the village from bandits Miyamoto 
must face his greatest opponent, the m=
aster swordsman Sasaki Kojiro.
Saturday, October 16, at 8am ET
